Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Midnight Kiss’ offers a sophisticated flavor profile: initial notes of wintergreen and grape, followed by a subtle floral sweetness with hints of mint, and a clean, tender texture. The flowers are 2-3 cm in diameter with velvety, deep purple-black petals and a small golden-yellow center that creates a striking “kiss” of contrast. The plant forms a dense, symmetrical mound of heart-shaped leaves just 15-20 cm tall, covered in blooms throughout the season.

2. The Ultimate Dramatic Garnish This viola’s intense color and complex flavor make it unparalleled for creating memorable culinary presentations.

  • Dessert Elegance: The premier use - as a stunning contrast on light-colored desserts like panna cotta, cheesecake, vanilla ice cream, or white chocolate creations.
  • Salad and Cheese Accent: Scattered over green salads or cheese boards where the dark flowers create dramatic visual impact against bright ingredients.
  • Candied Flower Specialty: Their sturdy petals and sweet base flavor make them ideal for crystallizing, creating exquisite dark jewels for decorating cakes and pastries.
  • Cocktail and Beverage Drama: Floating in champagne, white wine, or clear cocktails where they create a breathtaking “midnight sky” effect.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Midnight Kiss’ is a continuous bloomer when harvested regularly. Pick flowers in the morning when they are fully open but still fresh, choosing those with the deepest coloration. Supplied as a pre-seeded RFID Seed-Pad Cartridges, it provides a consistent yield of 25-35 perfect flowers per week, with first blooms appearing 55 days after germination and continuing until hard frost.
